Oportunidade: Engenheiro de Dados

Sobre a vaga
Se vocÃª busca atuar em uma empresa dinÃ¢mica e em crescimento acelerado, entÃ£o venha fazer parte do time que estÃ¡ transformando o ambiente de crÃ©dito do PaÃ­s!

Estamos em busca de um Engenheiro de Dados para atuar no nosso time!

O que vocÃª vai fazer:

Coletar dados de diversas fontes: bancos de dados, APIs, websites, arquivos de log, etc.
Limpar e organizar os dados: remover erros, inconsistÃªncias e duplicaÃ§Ãµes.
Transformar os dados: formatar os dados para que possam ser utilizados em ferramentas de anÃ¡lise.
Carregar os dados em data warehouses e data lakes: armazenar os dados de forma organizada e eficiente.
Criar pipelines de dados: automatizar o processo de coleta, transformaÃ§Ã£o e carregamento de dados.
Monitorar a qualidade dos dados: garantir que os dados estejam precisos e atualizados.
SeguranÃ§a e governanÃ§a de dados: proteger os dados contra acesso nÃ£o autorizado e garantir o uso adequado dos dados.
Colaborar com Analistas de NegÃ³cios: fornece aos usuÃ¡rios os dados necessÃ¡rios para realizar anÃ¡lises e tomar decisÃµes.
DocumentaÃ§Ã£o: manter registros detalhados das infraestruturas e processos de dados.
Coordenar as atividades das empresas terceiras envolvidas nos projetos
Garantir a qualidade das entregas e cumprimento dos prazos das empresas terceiras

GraduaÃ§Ã£o em Ã¡reas relacionadas.
ProgramaÃ§Ã£o em Python, Java, SQL, etc.
ExperiÃªncia com bancos de dados relacionais e nÃ£o relacionais (NoSQL).
ExperiÃªncia com ferramentas de Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.).

Entender e interpretar dados complexos.
Identificar padrÃµes e tendÃªncias nos dados.

[Oportunidade 5]
Oportunidade: Head of Data & Analytics

Sobre a vaga
About D3 Growth Partners
D3 Growth Partners excels in building businesses by adapting advanced tactics and best practices from leading companies to empower smaller businesses with a competitive edge. While others are stuck in the past, we harness the power of data warehouses, automation, and cutting-edge marketing technology.

Position Overview: Head of Analytics
Weâ€™re looking for a Head of Analytics to establish and lead the data function for one of our affiliated companies. If building a data-centric culture from scratch excites you, continue reading.

Build Something from the Ground Up: You'll be responsible for building the data function from scratch in this role. We already have a clean foundation (all data in a warehouse & basic views set up), but you will have complete ownership of building the data function.

Opportunities for Growth: The company assigned to this role is growing 300% per year - a super fast pace. With company growth comes new challenges and the opportunity for personal growth.

A Leadership Team that Embraces Data: The leaders you will work with are super data literate, so you'll be working with a team that embraces data-driven decision-making.

No Shortage of Challenging Problems to Solve: We have a TON of fun, challenging problems to solve with data.


Core Responsibilities:
Business Problem-Solving: Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights. Proactively seek opportunities and ask the right questions to drive business value.

Advanced SQL & Data Skills: Excel in SQL, including complex joins and window functions. Clean and transform data to extract meaningful insights.

Foundational Engineering Skills: Use tools like DBT to build and document reusable tables. Focus on creating scalable data solutions.

Data Visualization Expertise: Leverage data visualization tools to create interactive and insightful dashboards, enabling end users to explore data effectively.

Ensuring Data Integrity: Maintain high standards of data accuracy by performing rigorous checks and validating data transfers between sources.


Data Engineering & Dictionary: You can use tools like DBT to create tables that we can maintain and reuse, and youâ€™re able to document everything for scalabilityâ€™s sake.

Tableau / Data Visualization: Youâ€™re familiar with the power of data visualization and how to present data in a way that end users can cut, filter, manipulate, and solve problems.

Strong Data Integrity Intuition: We do our best to keep the data clean, but as we all know, no data is perfect. You know how to look at a set of tables and make sense of them. You can test your assumptions, and do gut checks on â€˜does this make senseâ€™? When we create data pipelines, youâ€™ll be the one making sure that data is transferred from one source to another properly.

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year
Benefits: Work from home
Experience level: 3-5 years
Schedule: 8 hour shift
Work Location: Remote
